Question
========

In single regression, when is the conditional standard deviation $s$ less than $s_{y}$?

Complete:

If the parameter ... deviates from 0, that is, if the square sum (SS) of ... is greater than 0. 
Answerlist
----------
* $\hat{\alpha}$, $(y-overline{y})$
* $\hat{\alpha}$, $(y-hat{y})$
* $(y-hat{y})$, $(y-overline{y})$
* $$hat{beta}$, $(y-\hat{y})$

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------
* Incorrect
* Incorrect
* Incorrect
* Correct
